subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 29, 2007

TOP STORIESWas London Bomb Plot Heralded On Web?
CBS News has learned that hours before police dismantled a car bomb in the heart of London's theater district, a message
                        appeared on one of the most widely used jihadist Web forums: "Today I say: Rejoice, by Allah, London shall be bombed." More...Watch: Expert On British Bomb Scare
• High Court Will Review Gitmo Cases• Cops Defuse Central London Car Bomb
                     					| Watch• Cheerleader Crash Driver Had Jr. LicenseU.S.Cheerleader Crash Driver Had Jr. License
A teenager who was at the wheel during a car crash that killed her and four other recent high school graduates from suburban
                        Rochester, N.Y., only had a junior driver's license, according to state records. More...
• No Relief For Rain-Weary Texas
                     					| Watch• Calif. Wildfires Wane, Some Head Home
                     					| Watch• High Court Will Review Gitmo Cases• More StoriesWorldCops Defuse Central London Car Bomb
London police have defused a "potentially viable explosive device" in a car in the central theater district. Officials say
                        propane canisters and nuts and bolts were found in car, and the device would have caused significant damage if it had exploded. More...Watch: Expert On British Bomb Scare
• 5 U.S. Soldiers Killed In Iraq Attack
                     					| Watch• Was London Bomb Plot Heralded On Web?
                     					| Watch• Castro: God Protected Me From Bush• More StoriesPoliticsHigh Court Will Review Gitmo Cases
The Supreme Court, reversing course, agreed to review whether Guantanamo Bay detainees may go to federal court to challenge
                        their confinement. In April, the court turned down an identical request. The move is a setback for the Bush administration. More...
• Debate Showcases Clinton-Obama Rivalry
                     					| Watch• Dems Decry Desegregation Ruling In Debate
                     					| Watch• The Truman Test
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthHow To Cut Midlife Heart Disease
Middle age isn't too late to cut heart disease if you adopt a healthy lifestyle, say experts. More...
• U.S. To Stop Some Chinese Seafood Imports
                     					| Watch• Lupus Drug May Cause Male Infertility• Bush Believes Americans Need More Exercise
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechMars Rover Ready For Make Or Break Trip
NASA's aging but durable Mars rover Opportunity will make what could be a trip of no return into a deep impact crater in an
                        attempt to peer further back than ever before into the geologic history of the Red Planet. More...
• Amazing Gene Swap Creates Microbe Makeover• House Nixes Auto Industry Mileage Plan• China Is Tops In Greenhouse Gas Emissions
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessFed Leaves Key Interest Rate Unchanged 
The Federal Reserve left a key interest rate unchanged, expressing new optimism on economic growth and lower inflation. Analysts
                        believe that Fed officials could keep rates as is through the rest of this year and well into 2008. More...
• Honda Tops In Customer Satisfaction Survey• Newspapers Not Quite Dead Yet• How To Avoid Summer Travel Snafus• More StoriesEntertainmentBritney And Mom At Odds Over Kids?
Paparazzi cameras caught Britney Spears on the set of her sister's TV show handing her mom what is reportedly a letter telling
                        her to stay away from her grandchildren. More...Watch: Britney's Back On Stage
• Best Books For Summer 2007
                     					| Watch• Coroner's Report: Jeni Was Mentally Ill• Streisand Awarded Legion Of Honor Medal• More StoriesOpinionRightward Ho!
Legal analyst Andrew Cohen says that two things are responsible for the Supreme Court's marked turn to the right: math
                        and art. More...Watch: Reading, Writing & Race
• Life Potatoes• Iraq's Key: Strength From Within
                     					| Watch• Stick With The Surge
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Summer Drinks In Big Batches
Bon Appetit magazine's Andrew Knowlton shared easy recipes for making them a pitcher at a time, without sacrificing taste,
                        on The Early Show. More...Watch: Make A Splash: Fun Cocktails

Lone Star Storms & FloodingAs more rain fell over Texas, cresting rivers began to overflow. There are renewed fears about more floods, evacuations and
                                    rescue operations. Hari Sreenivasan reports.
